title: Accused killer of 6-year-old shot in Knoxville to stand trial
content:
A Carrick man charged with killing a 6-year-old girl by shooting her in the head will stand trial.
Kamau Thomas Jr., 19, who is accused of fatally shooting Isis Allen, was held for court Wednesday on all charges at a preliminary hearing in City Court.
He next faces formal arraignment in Allegheny County Common Pleas Court.
Charges against Mr. Thomas were filed after Isis was struck in the head July 17 when the defendant fired a gun at a porch filled with people in Knoxville while trying to scare a man who had threatened him, according to police.
Isis was struck by the bullet and died several days later.
